intro: Gastonia dentata, commonly known as the toothed gastonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in the summer. Its roots are fibrous and often used in traditional medicine. Gastonia dentata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
